alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:08AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Heavy showers will impact portions of eastern Oswego County through 300 AM EDT... At 205 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a heavy shower and possible thunderstorm near Central Square, or 15 miles west of Camden, moving east at 10 mph. Additional showers will develop in the vicinity of the Tug Hill plateau. HAZARD...Torrential rain and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Central Square, Redfield, Richland, Constantia, West Monroe, Williamstown, Orwell, Cleveland, Altmar, Smartville, Amboy Center, Howardville, Mallory, Gayville, Salmon River Reservoir, Kasoag, Bernhards Bay and Lakeport. This includes Interstate 81 near exit 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Rainfall of an inch in less than an hours time is possible. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
